column4: i cant install ubuntu.. it says upgrade bios or use forced=something..
did you MD5 test the ISO you downloaded?
nope..cause i already used the cd in other pc's and it goes without error
i didnt actually do the ram test cause it doesnt appear :)
it doesn't by default, when you see the keyboard + stickman screen, press SPACE. You can also test the CD for defects there as well
i see.. so what am i going to do? btw my pc is kinda old
old is moot, as long as the ram is healthy it will be fine
i have sempron 3000+ 64bit enabled 512 ram and 256 vga
my media server uses one of those, it's not that old
i see.. btw i recieved help from yesterday(philippine time) from Dr_Willis...he said something like nomod something
let me see what that is
its one of the opts in the f6 menu on the stickman screen
the error? im using asus k8u-x motherboard
